intro: Craspedaria lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate craspeda, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. Native to certain regions of South America, it thrives in moist, temperate climates. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural study.
